alert.note: Alert for Chattooga (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:22PM EST until January 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattooga River at Summerville affecting Chattooga County. For the Chattooga River...including Summerville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattooga River at Summerville. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Minor flooding of woodlands and fields begins along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 27 or Rome Boulevard. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.3 feet on 03/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 830 AM EST.
